model.player

Interface PlayerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Player

    public interface PlayerInterface
    This interface defines the methods a Player should have.

    The Player has a hand, a balance, a name, and a boolean correlating to whether or not a player has folded.

    Since:
    9/26/16
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Emmet Murray

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a Card to hand.
      void discard(Card card)
      Discards a card, by removing it from hand.
      void fold()
      Folds by clearing hand and setting hasFolded to true.
      int getBalance()
      Returns the player's balance.
      java.util.ArrayList<Card> getHand()
      Returns the player's hand.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the player's name.
      boolean hasFolded()
      Returns whether or not the player has folded.
      void newHand()
      Resets hasFolded.
      void updateBalance(int amount)
      Updates the player's balance.
